Moser (1916) described
Holotrichia brunneipennis
from Juranda ( India ). We have studied a male type specimen conserved in MFNB, which shows external features that characterize the genus
Miridiba
. Hence, we have transferred
M. brunneipennis
to
Miridiba
. Unfortunately, we were unable to study the male genitalia because this type specimen only conserves the ninth genital segment, which does not allow us to assign it to any genital morphotype. Therefore,
M. brunneipennis
is considered as species incertae sedis within the genus
Miridiba
. The syntype specimen is designated as lectotype .
